title: StructFlowBench: A Structured Flow Benchmark for Multi-turn Instruction Following
author: Jinnan Li (Jilin University), Jinzhe Li (Jilin University), Yue Wang (University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill), Yi Chang (Jilin University), Yuan Wu (Jilin University)
relevance_why: The multi-turn instruction following capabilities highlighted in this paper provide insights into structuring audio instructions for improved interaction models, which can inform the design of audio generation tasks.
background: Developing benchmarks for evaluating large language models' ability to follow multi-turn user instructions in conversations.
contribution: StructFlowBench introduces a novel benchmark integrating a structural flow framework to evaluate multi-turn dialogue interactions, improving the analysis of user intent and conversational coherence.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous evaluation methods primarily focused on single-turn interactions and fine-grained constraints, lacking a comprehensive multi-turn framework.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances evaluation by introducing structural constraints that consider inter-turn dependency, providing a more holistic assessment.

key_innovation: The introduction of a six-category structural flow taxonomy that defines fundamental inter-turn relationships for structured dialogue analysis.
real_world_impact: This benchmark could help refine the development of more sophisticated audio and speech synthesis models, fostering better human-AI interaction in real-world applications.
limitations: The structural relationships are simplified to linear connections, potentially overlooking complex interdependencies in dialogues.

new_terms.multi-turn dialogue: **Multi-turn dialogue** refers to conversations that consist of multiple exchanges between users and systems, capturing the evolving nature of conversation over time.
new_terms.structural flow taxonomy: **Structural flow taxonomy** is a classification system that categorizes the relationships between different turns in a conversation, aiding in dialogue analysis.
